comment: I loved Traille! I took her Maymester, her last term teaching *retiring*. The 4-hour class for 8 days flew by. She used the textbook, but there were only 2 quizzes, a midterm with short essays, and a final exam with notes allowed. The exam used a lockdown browser and webcam. She provided opportunities for questions and review of lecture slides.

she is AMAZING! i had her for her 2111 maymester class and she is just the best! so sweet, so good at lecturing, very understanding and connects with her students. i struggle with history but she has a way of making me understand the content. i only had her for two weeks but she's the best professor i've ever had

Dr. Traille has an accent but she's very good at lecturing. You will have 2 test, midterm and final exam that can be taken at home. She does allow 1-3 pages of notes. She gives extra credit if you need to recover from a poor test grade. There are weekly readings in which you will have to summarize 3 topics in the reeadings, Fast grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Best professor I have ever had!

Great professor! Group work, guest speakers, lectures, interactive activities. Caters to all learning styles! Attendance is important, if you miss 6 classes you get failed. Show up, do your work and you'll excel.
Very last option honestly. Attendance is very important, and she relies on the textbook a lot...Take anyone else.

Dr. Traille is an amazing professor. Her class is always welcoming and people feel comfortable there. Her assignments are structured to prepare us for teaching and they are extremely beneficial. She always encourages students to participate and do the best they can. There were group assignments and presentations that were always educational.
I would 100% take Dr.Traille again. She makes sure that you are ready to go into the teaching field. She is also a very caring professor. Take this class !!

One of the best professors I've ever had. Encouraging and caring. Expect to work, but don't expect "busy work" as every assignment and reading serves a purpose. Dr. Traille is a great resource to learn the teaching profession from. Would take again.

Dr. Traille made our class engaging and connected with us throughout the semester. It is important to participate and be engaged throughout this course as this will help your understanding of the material which is content-based (you will do better on the assignments). There were group assignments and group discussions as well!
Traille is a funny, respected, and caring professor that wants you to succeed and grow. Every class was interesting and useful. She can be tough on grading but try and you should get a B at least.

Took this class as a 4 week course so it was at a fast pace, but ended up being one of my courses ever. Dr. Traille makes it seem difficult at first with the mandatory attendance but as long as you go everyday you'll end up doing well. Only had 2 tests and 2 quizzes but are open note, so as long as you have notes you shouldn't have trouble passing

I completed this course during the 2-week semester and it was fast! You must read the textbook, she provides a study guide which is helpful but some information that was not on the guide may be on quizzes/tests. She provided extra credit which allowed me get an A. Compared to other history professors she's great and makes the work understandable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: The lectures were great, if you simply show up and listen, she'll try her best to guide you to doing well in the course. Of course taken your own effort in to prepare for tests and quizzes, but as long as you're present you should be able to do well.
Wonderful professor. Her grading criteria can be unclear at times but as long as you speak up she will clarify. Other than that absolutely no complaints

Really fun class but little to no direction on assignments. Seems like it would be a very easy A class but its not. Not great about giving directions for assignments that count a great deal. Will give templates then expect you to know what to do perfectly and gets mad when you mess up. Is great about answering any emails in a quick manner.

Professor Traille is extremely nice, makes lectures interesting, and provides you with the material needed to succeed. She uses the lockdown browser and camera, but also a note sheet. She gives a guide before the test, and her weekly study sessions she covers most of the material (in 30 mins).
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Online because of COVID, Dr. Traille is very thoughtful and genuinely cares for her students. Two Lesson Plans (1 Tech Based), Two Presentations based on Readings, One Exam, and a Micro-Teaching Presentation (15 Min. Presentation on a theoretical Lesson Plan). Lots of reading at the beginning, but second half focused on Micro Teaching. Take her!

All the quizzes and test can be easily passed with Socratic an app. None of the test are lockdown with camera so if u get lower than an A you dont deserve the easy A because all the answers can be found with the app. Great lady very little effort required to pass took this class during the summer.

I was very disappointed in the class. She had 2-3 minute long videos for each unit/chapter in the textbook and powerpoints with incorrect grammar and typos. The only way you learned anything was from reading the textbook and she made the tests hard with extremely specific questions. I would not take her again and do not recommend her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: This was a very easy online summer class. We only had 2 quizzes, mid term and final exam. She used lock down browser, but no web cam. Plus, there were 3 discussion post and a very short easy (150-200) words. Highly recommend taking Dr. Traille.

Reading the reviews I expected it to be a good class but it was very hard and a waste of my money. She did not teach anything and only had you read the textbook. This made the tests and quizzes extremely difficult because SHE DIDN'T TEACH ANYTHING and picked questions that were very obscure. I am a straight-A student and got a B. Do not take her!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: This professor really encourages her class to collaborate on many assignments. Additionally, she is also very dedicated to her students and is willing to work with individual students one-on-one. Overall, she is a very solid professor and her course is very interactive in nature.

There's a discussion post per week, 2 quizzes, a midterm, & a final. No Lockdown Browser is required & class is cancelled for quizzes and tests, which she also gives reviews for & are based on the textbook. Discussion posts are fairly easy. Dr. Traille is open to discussion, likes participation, & is altogether a fun, kind person.

Dr. Traille is a wonderful teacher, but she is very strict. She cares about your grade. Midterm & Final, discussion board every other week, and 4 quizzes. All assignments are online and she cancels class for you to take the tests and quizzes at home. Mostly everything is on quizlet and theres no lockdown browser. Definitely take her.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: All assessments are online with no lockdown. The class itself was very fun and she is one of the best professors around! her accent makes it even better.

She is hilarious and her lectures are amazing. Just imagine a British woman teaching the American Revolution. It was great seeing a point of view not usually taught. I loved how she did not just teach in one format the entire class. She would lecture, have discussions, and show us videos so although it was a 3 hour class it went by extremely fast.

Very nice person and professor. Her participation was summaries of the chapters in the book. But you definitely want at least a grasp of whats going on in class because she likes students to speak up in class and will pick anyone.

2 quizzes, 2 tests (midterm and final). All 4 are online and Straight from the book. She provides a study guide for every test and quiz so its pretty hard to fail, they are also all multiple choice and true/false. Shes very funny, and her accent makes the class interesting.

Professor Traille is hilarious! Highly recommend taking her if you have the chance. All of her tests and quizzes were online and most information is out of the book. If I could take her again, I would.
Maymester Edition, 2017. British speaking, very caring and respected teacher. Reading is a must! Two quizzes, midterm, and final. 20% participation, need to be in class!

Professor Traille is a riot. Imagine a British person teaching a U.S. History class, and that is what you get. Jokes about fake american revolution and tangents on how to pronounce words. She is a good teacher and a solid choice; however, the class tends to get boring due to the long lectures.

Dr. Traille is an absolutely AMAZING professor! I took her this summer for 4 week class. We had three grades. The midterm was two 1000 word essays & the final was two 400 word reflections. Both worth 40% a piece. And the last 20% was just participation. She's a hilarious woman & takes the effort to learn everyone's name. Easy A!

Dr. Traille is the most engaging professor I've had at KSU. Participation is 20%. You must write about 3 interesting facts from reading and talk about them every day. You get to know people in the class. The other 40% is midterm and final, which are written take home. I learned quite a bit. She is very fun; mixes lecture up with video. Take her!

Dr. Traille is a very caring and thoughtful instructor. She does have a broad view of history and could sometimes include more relevant details while lecturing to students! However, she is incredibly funny and has a caring disposition. She really does want the best for her students. While some of her lectures are lacking, she has much charisma.

Dr. Traille is awesome. She is very funny, I really enjoyed going to her class. She is fair with grading. She wants her students to do well and she is always available to help. Take her if you have a chance to do so!
Wonderful professor.  Makes learning fun.  Easy midterm and final
